direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods validate IP addresses but for different versions (IPv4 and IPv6). They share similar control flow and validation logic.
The isValid method calls both isValidInet4Address and isValidInet6Address, making it a direct dependency for testing both IP address validation methods.
Both methods use regular expressions to validate input strings, sharing similar pattern matching and validation structures.
The validate method in RegexValidator can be used to validate parts of the IPv6 address, providing a similar validation mechanism.
